    • getElementsCount

      public static int getElementsCount​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, int numberOfAttempts)
      Returns the number of elements that match a certain elementLocator
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      numberOfAttempts - the number of retries before returning a count [returns zero if no elements were found after all the retries]
      Returns:
      integer value that represents the number of elements that match the desired elementLocator

    • getElementsCount

      public static int getElementsCount​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, int numberOfAttempts, boolean waitForLazyLoading)
      Returns the number of elements that match a certain elementLocator
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      numberOfAttempts - the number of retries before returning a count [returns zero if no elements were found after all the retries]
      waitForLazyLoading - if true, will wait before lazy loading, else if false skips this wait
      Returns:
      integer value that represents the number of elements that match the desired elementLocator

    • getAttribute

      public static java.lang.String getAttribute​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String attributeName)
      Get the value of the given attribute of the element. Will return the current value, even if this has been modified after the page has been loaded.

      More exactly, this method will return the value of the property with the given name, if it exists. If it does not, then the value of the attribute with the given name is returned. If neither exists, null is returned.

      The "style" attribute is converted as best can be to a text representation with a trailing semi-colon.

      The following are deemed to be "boolean" attributes, and will return either "true" or null:

      async, autofocus, autoplay, checked, compact, complete, controls, declare, defaultchecked, defaultselected, defer, disabled, draggable, ended, formnovalidate, hidden, indeterminate, iscontenteditable, ismap, itemscope, loop, multiple, muted, nohref, noresize, noshade, novalidate, nowrap, open, paused, pubdate, readonly, required, reversed, scoped, seamless, seeking, selected, truespeed, willvalidate

      Finally, the following commonly mis-capitalized attribute/property names are evaluated as expected:

      If the given name is "class", the "className" property is returned. If the given name is "readonly", the "readOnly" property is returned. Note: The reason for this behavior is that users frequently confuse attributes and properties. If you need to do something more precise, e.g., refer to an attribute even when a property of the same name exists, then you should evaluate Javascript to obtain the result you desire.

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      attributeName - the target attribute of the webElement under test
      Returns:
      the value of the target attribute of the webElement under test

    • getCSSProperty

      public static java.lang.String getCSSProperty​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String propertyName)
      Get the value of a given CSS property. Color values should be returned as rgba strings, so, for example if the "background-color" property is set as "green" in the HTML source, the returned value will be "rgba(0, 255, 0, 1)". Note that shorthand CSS properties (e.g. background, font, border, border-top, margin, margin-top, padding, padding-top, list-style, outline, pause, cue) are not returned, in accordance with the DOM CSS2 specification - you should directly access the longhand properties (e.g. background-color) to access the desired values.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      propertyName - the target CSS property of the webElement under test
      Returns:
      the value of the target CSS property of the webElement under test

    • waitForTextToChange

      public static void waitForTextToChange​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String initialValue, int numberOfTries)
      Waits dynamically for a specific element's text to change from the initial value to a new unknown value. Waits for a specific number of retries multiplied by the default element identification timeout (in the POM.xml file)
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      initialValue - the initial text value of the target webElement
      numberOfTries - the number of times to try and wait for the element text to change (default is 1)

    • waitForElementToBePresent

      public static void waitForElementToBePresent​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, int numberOfTries, boolean stateOfPresence)
      Waits dynamically for a specific element to achieve the desired stateOfPresence on the current page. Waits for a specific number of retries multiplied by the default element identification timeout (in the POM.xml file)
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      numberOfTries - the number of times to try and wait for the element to achieve the desired stateOfPresence (default is 1)
      stateOfPresence - the expected state of presence of the element; false is not present, and true is present

    • isElementDisplayed

      public static boolean isElementDisplayed​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Checks to see if an element is displayed
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      Returns:
      boolean value, true if the element is displayed, and false if the element is not displayed

      public static boolean isElementClickable​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Checks to see if an element is clickable
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      Returns:
      boolean value, true if the element is clickable, and false if the element is not clickable

    • clipboardActions

      public static void clipboardActions​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String action)
      Attempts to perform a native clipboard action on the text from a certain web element, like copy/cut/paste
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      action - supports the following actions "copy", "paste", "cut", "select all", "unselect"

    • setValueUsingJavaScript

      public static void setValueUsingJavaScript​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String value)
      Used to set value for an element (hidden or visible) using javascript
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      value - the desired value that should be set for the target element

    • submitFormUsingJavaScript

      public static void submitFormUsingJavaScript​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Used to submit a form using javascript
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)

    • executeNativeMobileCommand

      public static void executeNativeMobileCommand​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, java.lang.String command, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> parameters)
      This is a generic method to enable the execution of any of the native mobile commands found herein: http://appium.io/docs/en/commands/mobile-command/

      Note: This method does no validation on the output of the executed JavaScript

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver, which should wrap around a native mobile object
      command - the desired mobile command to be executed. e.g., "mobile: scroll"
      parameters - a map of the key, value parameters for this command. e.g., ImmutableMap.of("direction", "down")

    • performTouchAction

      public static Touch performTouchAction​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
      This is a convenience method to be able to call Touch Actions for touch-enabled devices from within the regular Element Actions Class.

      Sample use would look like this: ElementActions.performTouchAction().tap(driver, loginButton);

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver, which should wrap around a native mobile object
      Returns:
      a Touch object capable of performing actions on touch-enabled devices
